section.title: Migrating to ll-core 1.3
section.par: ll.make has been largely rewritten, so you have to adapt your make scripts. For examples demontrating how to do this, take a look at either the small example in the module itself or the make script for the website.

section.title: Migrating to ll-core 1.2
section.par: Processing instruction targets in ll.xpit now require whitespace after the target name. This means that you have to replace <?=foo?> with <?= foo?> in your xpit strings.

section.title: Migrating to ll-core 1.1
section.par: If you've been using TOXICAction from ll.make, you have to use a DecodeAction before the TOXICAction to decode the str object into a unicode object and use a EncodeAction afterwards to encode it again as the constructor of TOXICAction no longer takes an encoding argument, but operates on unicode strings directly.

section.title: Migrating to ll-core 1.0
section.par: The content of the ll module has been move to ll.misc, so you have to replace e.g. ll.notimplemented with misc.notimplemented etc.
